channel.title: Detecting bots
channel.description:
I saw a thread about making a bot for a rsps, I was just wondering how you would go about detecting bots?
And does Jagex detect them, or do they just assume that people are botting?

item.title: Detecting bots
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:12, topic:522910”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=641404.msg4322161#msg4322161 date=1372355005]

They have a security system called botwatch.

sounds like a horrible system
[/quote]-sees bots on eoc
-sees bots on 07

yep it’s a horrible system[/quote]
Yerp.

Read full topic

item.title: Detecting bots
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

i don’t know why someone would want to bot on a private server. however, you would like to add a random event system ‘just in case’ something did happen, to keep your economy safe. there’s been lots of random event systems been released which you can use.

here’s my little tester one, no where near finished (just a base so you can see):

[code]package server.model.players;

import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
import java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

import server.Server;
import server.util.Misc;

public class DetectBot implements MouseMotionListener {

/**
 * Client constructor
 */
Client c;

/**
 * The amount of movements that can be made within the same region.
 */
private final int movementBlocks = 100;

/**
 * Writes a file with the players name and mouse movements
 * @param movement
 */
@Override
public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent movement) {
    String fileName = "bots.txt";
    try {
    	FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter(fileName);
    	BufferedWriter bufferedWriter = new BufferedWriter(fileWriter);  	
    	if(movement != null) {
			bufferedWriter.write(c.playerName + " moved their mouse: " + movement);
		}
    	} catch(IOException ex) {
			// TODO Auto-generated catch block
			ex.printStackTrace();
		}
	
}

/**
 * Checks a mouse movement made by a player.
 * @param movement
 * @param x
 * @param y
 */
public void checkMouseMovement(MouseEvent movement, int x, int y) {
	if(movementBlocks >= 100) {
		if(x > c.absX && x < c.absY) {
			/**
			 * Sends a packet to the client.
			 */
			c.sendMessage(":handlebot:");
		}
	}
}
	
	

/**
 * Determines a random event for the bot.
 */
public void testBlock() {
	switch(Misc.random(movementBlocks - 10)) {
	case 100:
		c.getPA().movePlayer(1, 1, 1);
		break;
	case 92:
		c.getPA().showInterface(409);
		break;
	case 98:
		Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 1, 1, 1, 0 , 1, 210, 23, 15, 10, true, true);
		break;
	case 95:
		c.forcedChat("I'M GAY!");
		break;
}
	
}

@Override
public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent movement) {
	// TODO Auto-generated method stub
	
}

}[/code]

i wanted to use mouse events so you could see the amount of movement(s)/drag(s) created by the player, if these movements overlapped 100 times, it would write to the log file. the username would be taken from the logged file and be given a random event (such as spawning an npc) to stop you. furthermore, you could possibly add some sort of fraction from the random event: ban, ip ban, mute etcetera.

Read full topic

item.title: Detecting bots
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:7, topic:522910”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=641404.msg4321182#msg4321182 date=1372229438]
The client does record all mouse movements, and sends them back to the server at regular intervals if your account is flagged. Once that data is on the server who knows what happens
[/quote]

Oh that’s really cool, i didn’t know that.

RSPS bots don’t have protection against anything they weren’t programmed for. If you make your own randoms I guarantee it would stop all bots. You could change the protocol around a bit too too only allow your client.

I’m sure someone could make a script to get past random events.[/quote]
Yeah, they could, but when it gets to that point of trying to bot I’m pretty sure you’re better off letting them go XD

Read full topic

Lin:

RSPS bots don’t have protection against anything they weren’t programmed for. If you make your own randoms I guarantee it would stop all bots. You could change the protocol around a bit too too only allow your client.

I’m sure someone could make a script to get past random events.

item.title: Detecting bots
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:1, topic:522910”]I saw a thread about making a bot for a rsps, I was just wondering how you would go about detecting bots?

And does Jagex detect them, or do they just assume that people are botting?[/quote]
I believe they just see if the player is doing the same exact thing over a long period. It’s just a guess, because I see some bots have anti-ban, which is usually a different movement every time.

Read full topic
